readme.welcome-general:
Welcome to Explosive Gaming; we host many factorio servers. While you are here, we ask you to follow our rules. You can find these in the tab above. You can also find our custom commands and links to our other servers. This map has been online for __2__.
Please note that our servers reset periodically, the next reset is: __1__
readme.welcome-roles:
We run a custom role system to help protect the work of others. As a result you may not be able to use your deconstruction planner yet or drop item on the groud. Roles also give you access to some custom features such as adding tasks to our task list or making new warp points.
You have been assigned the roles: __1__
readme.welcome-chat:
Chatting can be difficult for new players because it’s different than other games! It’s very simple, the button you need to press is the “GRAVE/TILDE” key (which is located under the “ESC key”) - If you would like to change the key, go to your Controls tab in options.
The setting you need to change is “Toggle chat (and Lua console)” you currently have it set to '__CONTROL__toggle-console__'
readme.rules-general: By playing on our servers you accept the rules below. If you are supected of breaking a rule then you will be questioned by one of our moderators. If required you will be banned from our servers, appeals can be made by contacting an Administrator on our discord.
readme.rules-1: Hacking / cheating / abusing bugs will not be tolerated.
readme.rules-2: Any bugs or exploits found should be reported to our staff members.
readme.rules-3: Be respectful to other players in chat, this includes any other forms of communication.
readme.rules-4: Taking all items from a belt or logistics network is forbidden: sharing resources is mandatory.
readme.rules-5: Spamming of chat, bots, unlimited chests, or concrete is not allowed.
readme.rules-6: Before removing major parts of the factory tell other players why you are removing it.
readme.rules-7: Do not cause unnecessary lag by placing/removing tiles with bots or using active provider chests, if think some thing might cause lag please ask staff first.
readme.rules-8: Do not walk in random directions with no reason, this is to reduce map download times.
readme.rules-9: Do not use speakers on global or with alerts without prior permission, no one wants to hear your music at full volume without knowing where the off switch is.
readme.rules-10: Do not rotate belts, deactivate belts with wires, or cause production to stop without good reason, this goes for inserters and spliters as well.
readme.rules-11: Do not make train roundabouts. Other loops such as RoRo stations are allowed.
readme.rules-12: When using trains, use the same size other players have used, many players use 1-2-1, 2-4-2, or 3-8-3, meaning 1 engine 2 cargo 1 engine.
readme.rules-13: Trains are Left Hand Drive (LHD) only, this means trains drive on the left side of the tracks.
readme.rules-14: Do not beg for roles, advertise other servers, or link to harmful sites.
readme.rules-15: Use common sense, report rule breakers, and Administrators have the final word.
readme.commands-tooltip: Commands which you are able to use
readme.commands-general: We have lots of custom commands which you are able to use. Below you can find a list of all the commands that you are allowed to use and what they do. If you need more information or want to search for a command you can use our /search-help command.
readme.servers-tooltip: Links to our other servers and sites
readme.servers-general: This is only one of our servers for factorio, we host many of others as well. Below you can find details about all the servers that we host as well as links to our external services such as discord or github.
readme.servers-d1: This is our 48 hour reset server.
readme.servers-d3: This is our weekly reset server.
readme.servers-d4: This is our monthly reset server.
readme.servers-d5: This is our modded server, see discord for details.
readme.servers-d6: This is our donator only server, online when requested.
readme.servers-d7: This is our event server, we try to run events at least once per week.
readme.servers-connect-Version: Server is on a different version: __1__
readme.servers-connect-Modded: Server requires mods to be downloaded
readme.backers-tooltip: People who have helped make our server
readme.backers-general: We would like to thank all our staff and backers who have helped our community grow. Our staff have helped to keep our servers safe from trolls and a fun place to play. Our backers have helped us to cover our running costs and provide a great community for us all to enjoy together.
readme.data-tooltip: All of your stored player data
readme.data-general: Our servers will save your player data so that we can sync it between servers. All of your data can be found below, if you wish to save a copy locally then use /save-data. If you want to change what data is saved then use /set-preference.
